hypothesis_content.title: Momentum Failure at Bull Regime Support as Early Stress Signal
hypothesis_content.statement: In a BULL regime, if BTC price pulls back to and breaches its key 50-day moving average (a bull market support), and then fails to reclaim it within 3 trading days on declining volume (< 10-day avg), it signals an elevated risk of an imminent transition to a NEUTRAL or STRESS regime, with a short-term edge for a mean reversion short play targeting a -4% move.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In a healthy bull market, dips to the 50-day MA are typically bought aggressively with conviction (high volume). A failure to reclaim this level with low volume indicates a lack of committed buyers, suggesting the underlying bullish trend is weakening. This momentum failure often precedes a period of correction or consolidation.
entry_conditions: BTC price closes below 50-day simple moving average
For the next 3 days, price fails to close above the 50-day SMA
Average volume over those 3 days < 10-day average volume

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price closes >2% above the 50-day SMA
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 trading days after entry (or upon regime change signal)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The failure at the 50-day SMA is not a reliable leading indicator, and the market resumes its bull trend >60% of the time without entering a lower-regime phase within 10 days.
